body:
<!--

    Please do *NOT* ask usage questions in Github issues.

    If your issue is not a feature request or bug report use:
    https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/prometheus-users. If
    you are unsure whether you hit a bug, search and ask in the
    mailing list first.

    You can find more information at: https://prometheus.io/community/

-->

**What did you do?**
Upgraded from 2.16.0 -> 2.17.0.

**What did you expect to see?**
Not such a big increase of rule's evaluation time.

**What did you see instead? Under which circumstances?**
As "_a picture is worth a thousand words_" see the screenshots attached:

**prometheus_rule_group_last_duration_seconds:**
![200325-170434 prometheus_rule_group_last_duration_seconds](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25924718/77559167-1dbc2d00-6ebc-11ea-92da-f47334555870.png)

**engine_query_duration_seconds (the second graph uses the log10 scale for the Y-axis):**
![200325-170802 engine_query_duration_seconds](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25924718/77559239-3a586500-6ebc-11ea-9208-a8514a60fc61.png)

Note the increase of the `prepare_time` slice...

During the time from about 10 am to about 15 pm we were using the version 2.17.0.

**Environment**

* System information:
```
 Kernel Version:                  5.3.0-24-generic
 OS Image:                        Ubuntu 18.04.2 LTS
 Operating System:                linux
```

* Prometheus version:
	2.17.0
title: Query/Rule Time Regression After Upgrade To 2.17.0
